header.title: Brexit: Are Remainers Ageist?
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: Brexit supporters are often slandered as 'racists and idiots'. But the past week has shown a similar smear can also be used against Remainers. Is this fair?. . Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Rose_Of_Dawn. . Support me on SubscribeStar: https://www.subscribestar.com/rose-of...
header.socioLingVar: Nationality - European or anti-Europeans,Age - Over 65s,Nationality - General,Age - General,Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments

commentThread.commentText: Thank you for this video. As an under-25 Remainer, I am absolutely sick of fellow young people blaming older people for Brexit. 1) There are young Leavers and older Remainers. 2) A pitiful number of young people turned out to vote, so blame your own generation for not caring.

I think Brexit is a terrible idea, but you don't get to redo a referendum. If you've siad you'll respect it you respect it. (I think a referendum is a terrible way to solve a complicated issue, though.)
Well done! Thank you for standing up for us!
(These people are transgenders.) FTM 'Tommy Robertson' is MI5, and probably Mossad.

I voted Remain, been in the EU all my working life and worked in several EU countries. I do understand why people would vote leave, I don't want to leave but Leave won. I'm quite old, but younger than Polly bloody Toynbee! I'm not dying any time soon...
Great video. Your twitter link has an extra . after com btw.

I voted to leave based on my parents' distrust of the EU oligarchy, but I did my research well before the referendum. If remain had won, I would have been disappointed but would accept the vote. That's not saying I would not agitate to leave, but that comes from the ugly head we see being raised in Brussels after the vote. I would think most remainers have accepted the mandate, and wish to get on with Brexit, but many are exhausted from the constant dilution of leaving. No doubt the government wish to capitalise on that, so we get the merry-go-round of the blame game - the first rule of politics, it seems. I don't blame one side or another for any division in the UK, the fault can be laid squarely with those charged with implementing our will.
Good video, you need more comments. 😉
I've given up discussing Brexit to any real degree.

replies.commentText:
It's an incredibly toxic topic, to be sure. But I felt I couldn't let this slide.

Also I gotta do more non-tranny videos.

commentThread.commentText: Degenerate remainer, get the guillotine, time to deal with dissidents the way the french used to 😂

The issue with the extreme pro-remain types, was that they were more anti-leave than pro-remain. If there was a dominant euro-sceptic remain element that also understood the concerns of those who voted Brexit, I wouldn't have switched to voting Brexit at the last minute. I wish we'd had bigger balls to challenge the EU and make it into something far less authoritarian and more focused on plurality. Just feels lik e Alien Vs Predator whenever I vote these days. Whoever wins, we lose. I want a positive visionary as a leader for once.

What the 2016 ref did, was put eyes on the EU and how they operate. This is why I'm confident (based on chats I've had with Remainers) that a 2nd ref would still end up as leave. My reasoning? Well as mentioned, the EU has eyes on it from people who weren't clued up about it before and assumed (like I did at the time) it was purely a trading bloc. I know people who voted remain because they were concerned about house prices, I know people who voted remain because they wanted to travel to Europe. I'm not kidding, they voted that way because they genuinely thought they wouldn't be able to enter Europe had we left. I even know someone who voted remain because they were concerned about the price of cheese... And they say the Brexit Voters wer e dumb... Anyway, great vid and a great point you make about t he ageism argument. It's definitely a valid one they can't refute based on their logic.

replies.commentText: And, I am still hearing the 'won't be able to travel' :)! and 'we will not have human rights' from remainers ! :( .... but mention the CFP, or CAP, and there is ... 'blank'. I think there would be even more votes to leave if there was another vote - people grow up! - and think this is why they have been so keen on extension, and/or trying to renege on art.50 in parliament instead. The 'OFuck' death stuff has been offensive (and everyone ages :)).This ploy to get younger and younger people to vote as less experienced and more easily manipulated is unsound ++++.

commentThread.commentText:
I've heard the not all, but all argument too...

Infuriating.
